alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Haralson, southwestern Carroll, northern Heard and west central Coweta Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Trickem to near Napoleon to near Waresville, and moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Buchanan, Bremen, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Waco, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Bowdon Junction, Tyus, Roosterville, Clem, Frolona, John Tanner State Park, Lowell, Plant Wansley and Blackjack Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
